About.Name: David Lee
About.Currently: Electrical Engineering Student with a Background in Biology
About.AboutText:
Hello, I am David Lee. I am a passionate electrical engineering student with a keen interest in biotech and biomed engineering. Currently, I am pursuing my undergraduate degree at Seattle Pacific University. I am dedicated to expanding my knowledge and skills in various areas of electrical engineering and biology.

I enjoy tackling challenging technical projects, and I thrive in collaborative environments where I can contribute my expertise and learn from my peers.

Beyond the classroom, I actively engage in extracurricular activities related to community building as a Resident Advisor and learning new hobbies. I believe in the importance of continuous learning and seek out opportunities to explore new technologies and methodologies.

Experience.ExperienceText: I am an electrical engineer with practical experience in embedded systems power-electronics and humanâ€“machine interfaces. I built an EMG-controlled prosthetic hand with custom signal filtering ADC mapping and motion logic. I designed PCBs that include a multi voltage power stage a buck converter a boost converter and an isolated DC AC flyback converter which strengthened my skills in power systems and PCB layout. I am currently developing a mobile solar power generator for disaster relief and mission critical use with features such as MPPT control battery management and rugged mechanical design. I focus on creating systems that are technically strong and highly useful in real world applications across electronics biomechanics and sustainable technology.
Experience.EducationText: I studied electrical engineering with a focus on circuits, powersystems, microcontrollers signal processing, and bio-inspired design. My work in these areas helped me build strong skills in analysis, design, and hands-on engineering practice.
Experience.Role: Resident Advisor and Anatomy and Physiology Teaching & Lab Assistant
Experience.EmploymentText: In my role as a Resident Advisor and as an Anatomy and Physiology Teaching and Lab Assistant, I support both student learning and student community life. As a Resident Advisor, I mentor residents, guide conflict resolution, and help create a safe and supportive living environment. As a Teaching and Lab Assistant, I prepare weekly labs, assist students during experiments, and reinforce key concepts in human biology. These roles strengthened my leadership communication and problem-solving skills, and they taught me how to support others with patience, clarity, and professionalism.
Experience.SkillsText: My skills include embedded programming circuit-design, PCB layout, and signal analysis. I enjoy solving engineering problems and creating systems that are clear, functional, and dependable.

Project1.Title: DC-DC Converter & DC-AC Inverter
Project1.Desc: Designed and printed PCB that had buck and boost converter along with the DCAC Flyback inverter design

Project2.Title: EMG Signal Reading Prosthetic Arm
Project2.Desc: Developed a prosthetic that read muscle activities and flexed the fingers accordingly

Project3.Title: Simulation of Solar Power Generator
Project3.Desc: Simulation model that displays the mobile solar power generator output data depending on various input variables.
